page.title: 08 SOUNDS HEARD AROUND RUGELEY
page.content: The enormous, roaring, aggravating, alarm blast of the power station safety valves releasing. The sudden wide silence when the power station valves shut down. The fluttering flight of a flock of racing pigeons exercising. The rumbling, rattling, bumping, banging drone of lorries carrying pit- spoil to the dump. The wasp-like whine of the pit siren when the shifts change over. Clickety-clack of railway wagons passing over the Rugeley bridges. Ear-splitting scream of jet aircraft practising low flying techniques. Soft buzz of chattering shoppers in Rugeleys newly paved traffic free town centre. We predict these sounds will no longer be heard in the year 2085.
